content:
Sure, there are many great resources available to help you learn more about Photoshop. Here are some suggestions:

1. Adobe's official website: Adobe provides a range of tutorials and resources for Photoshop users, including video tutorials, tips and tricks, and access to the community forum. 2. Lynda.com: Lynda is an online learning platform that offers courses and tutorials on Photoshop and other design software. It is a paid service, but many libraries and educational institutions offer free access to Lynda for their members. 3. YouTube: There are many YouTube channels dedicated to Photoshop tutorials, ranging from basic to advanced techniques. Some popular channels include Phlearn, Piximake, and Photoshop Training Channel. 4. Photoshop blogs: There are many Photoshop blogs that provide tutorials, resources, and inspiration for Photoshop users. Some popular blogs are Smashing Magazine, PSDtuts, and Digital Arts Online. 5. Photoshop user groups: There are many local and online user groups that allow you to connect with other Photoshop users and learn from their experiences. You can find groups on websites such as Meetup or Facebook. I hope these resources will help you to learn more about Photoshop and improve your skills. Good luck!
